meanings.sent1: I enjoy snacking on sweet prunes.
meanings.sent2: The store sells prunes in the dried fruit section.
meanings.sent3: The prunes in my cereal danced around like little wrinkled fairies.
meanings.sent4: The wrinkled prunes looked like tiny old wizards casting spells.
meanings.sent5: The wrinkled prunes were like little nuggets of concentrated flavor.

meanings.definition: To cut away or reduce the size of something by removing unnecessary parts.
meanings.sent1: She prunes the bushes in her garden to keep them neat.
meanings.sent2: The gardener prunes the tree branches to help them grow better.
meanings.sent3: He prunes his essay by removing all the extra words like a skilled sculptor.
meanings.sent4: Pruning away the distractions, she focused on her goals like a sharp blade.
meanings.sent5: The chef prunes the recipe down to its essential ingredients for the best flavor.

meanings.definition: To dry or preserve something by removing moisture.
meanings.sent1: She prunes the herbs from her garden to dry them for winter.
meanings.sent2: The sun naturally prunes the fruit hanging on the tree.
meanings.sent3: He prunes the wet clothes on the line to speed up the drying process.
meanings.sent4: Time prunes away the memories, leaving only the essence of the moment.
meanings.sent5: The desert air prunes the fruit, turning it into delicious dried snacks.
